intro: Berkheya onopordifolia, commonly known as the yellow oxalis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble those of the oxalis genus. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy, narrow leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. Berkheya onopordifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
